file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 28-41-01-04 - FUEL CONDITIONING UNIT (FCU) - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FUEL CONDITIONING UNIT (FCU) - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the fuel conditioning unit. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 28-41-01-000-801-A FUEL CONDITIONING UNIT - REMOVAL FUEL CONDITIONING UNIT - INSTALLA- ALL 28-41-01-400-801-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 28-41-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-41-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. FUEL CONDITIONING UNIT - REMOVAL A. General (1) Obey the instructions that follow to remove the fuel conditioning unit. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 123 221GF Cockpit 124 221GF Cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers that follow and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to them: • REFUELING 1/2/3. • FUEL QTY IND 1/2. • START 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-41-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Open door 221GF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100) to get access to the fuel conditioning unit. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove bolts (1) and washers (2). (2) Disconnect the electrical connectors (3) from the fuel conditioning unit (4). (3) Remove the fuel conditioning unit (4). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-41-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Fuel Conditioning Unit - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONES 123 124 DET. A 4. FCU 1. BOLT 2. WASHER 3. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR DET. B 3. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 145AMM280086.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-41-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-41-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. FUEL CONDITIONING UNIT - INSTALLATION A. General (1) Obey the instructions that follow to install the fuel conditioning unit. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - ELECTRICAL FUEL QUANTITY - OPERATIONAL AMM TASK 28-41-00-700-801-A/500 CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 123 221GF Cockpit 124 221GF Cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, make sure that the circuit breakers that follow are open and with a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag attached to them: • REFUELING 1/2/3. • FUEL QTY IND 1/2. • START 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-41-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Put the fuel conditioning unit (4) in position. (2) Install the bolts (1) and the washers (2). (3) Connect the electrical connectors (3). NOTE: Make sure the connectors are clean and firmly attached. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do the Electrical Fuel-Quantity Operational Check ( AMM TASK 28-41-00-700-801-A/ 500). (2) Do an inspection on the fuel-quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Aircraft Maintenance Program. (3) Close access door 221GF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (4) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers that follow and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • REFUELING 1/2/3. • FUEL QTY IND 1/2. • START 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-41-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
